oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Frank G. Collins correspondence with the School Board, 1956 February 8
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Collins, Frank G.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Letter from an Atlanta, Georgia citizen to the Board of Education in Chattanooga, Tennessee in support of the board's decision to integrate the public schools. The author, Frank G. Collins, a self-proclaimed "white, Christian, American citizen" goes on to condemn the Chattanooga News Free Press's support of violence in opposition to integration in Chattanooga.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Segregation in education -- Tennessee -- Chattanooga
Chattanooga (Tenn.). Board of Education
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:source: Chattanooga Board of Education correspondence and memoranda, 1955-1957
Chattanooga Board of Education records and correspondence, 1953-1961
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:isPartOf: Raymond B. Witt Chattanooga Public Schools desegregation records
